name: Level Up
purpose: Turn curiosity into confidence. This pillar shows the cards actively helping someone make a better mezcal choice: what to order, what to taste next, how to compare, and how to build a simple ritual around the deck.
what_this_pillar_is: Cards used as a guide: choosing the next sip, comparing tasting notes, ordering smarter.
Small rituals: tasting flights, one-card prompts, ‘pick a card then pour’ flow.
Progression: from ‘I don’t know mezcal’ to ‘I’ve got this’ in one moment.
Practical but still sexy: warm, tactile, real-world settings, not classroom vibes.
what_this_pillar_is_not: Plant-only agave texture study (that is Discover).
Corporate training, diagrams, overlays, or heavy instructional text.

content_goals.brand_goal: Make the deck feel like the easiest way to learn mezcal without being lectured.
content_goals.audience_goal: Give people a ‘I can do this’ moment that makes them want the cards.
content_goals.content_goal: Create save-worthy posts that feel useful and premium.

visual_story_rules.core_rule: Every Level Up image must show the cards improving the mezcal decision in the scene.
hook_types_ranked: card placed beside a glass right before a sip
tasting flight arranged with cards as labels
hand holding a card while scanning a menu (menu text must be blurred/illegible)
simple product pairing: deck box + one face card (minimal, not sterile)
card guiding an order at a bar table
composition_bias: cleaner than Play, but still lived-in and tactile
tight framing, no wide empty rooms
